8971/A0/04/800/001.status_value: During the reporting period office held 5 All staff meetings and 2 KMT meetings.
8971/A0/04/800/001.indicator_name: The KMT remains the central management body  advising the Representative on programme implementation  management and performance  and how to keep human and financial resources focused on office priorities

8971/A0/04/800/002.status_value: During the reporting period office had no unutilized amount from PBAs at the expiring date.
8971/A0/04/800/002.indicator_name: % of funds not utilised from PBA's at the expiring date

8971/A0/04/800/002.status_value: As of date  office have 1% of > than 6 months un-liquidated DCTs.
8971/A0/04/800/002.indicator_name: Number of DCT's > than 6 months with total pending amount percentage

8971/A0/04/800/003.status_value: 100% of 2014 PASs were completed and signed by both parties by end of reporting period.
8971/A0/04/800/003.indicator_name: % of PASs completed and signed by both parties by the end of February

8971/A0/04/002/007.indicator_name: Unit cost per child in preschool education

8971/A0/04/002/007.status_value: Key education indicators calculated and made publicly available to be used as evidence for budget planning and monitoring (KOSOVO EDUCATION INDICATORS 2009/10  2010/11 AND 2011/12  June 2013)
8971/A0/04/002/007.indicator_name: Employment of MEST/EMIS-generated evidence for child-focused budget planning/budgeting

8971/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Institutionalised  specialised and quality training exists for all police officers  prosecutors  judges  lawyers  social workers and psychologists working with children in justice processes (RKLA 2)
8971/A0/05/003/001.headline: Child protection law was developed by Kosovo Institutions as a contribution to building equitable and inclusive society. Foster care and alternative care system introduced for children without adequate parental care  and the revision of juvenile justice Code finalized to make the rule of law more child friendly

8971/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Number of municipalities with the capacity to identify and address cases of violence and have established case management roundtables  including Serbian majority municipalities in the North
8971/A0/05/003/001.headline: Child protection law was developed by Kosovo Institutions as a contribution to building equitable and inclusive society. Foster care and alternative care system introduced for children without adequate parental care  and the revision of juvenile justice Code finalized to make the rule of law more child friendly

8971/A0/04/002/020.indicator_name: % of increase of social assistance benefit for families
Number of approved Administrative Instructions of social assistance scheme
allocated budget for social assistance as % of government budget

8971/A0/04/002/020.status_value: For the purpose of addressing the bottleneck of the lack of a national strategic document in social protection UNICEF has commissioned Mapping of Social Protection in Kosovo report with the objective of informing the development of the new Strategy on Employment and Social Welfare 2014-2020 so that it is adopts a multi sectorial approach to social protection and is child-sensitive.
8971/A0/04/002/020.indicator_name: Employment of evidence for child-focused planning/budgeting generated by data & information management system (DMIS) of the social protection sector

8971/A0/04/003/024.status_value: The legal review of Kosovo legislation on media and children and ethical reporting on children rights is conducted and launched.  Based on the report an administrative instruction is to be developed on media and children.
8971/A0/04/003/024.indicator_name: legal review on ethical standards for reporting on children is conducted to develop an administrative instruction to guide and set standards for media reporting on children

8971/A0/04/003/024.status_value: Two studies conducted on social norms as one of bottlenecks to realization of children rights: C4D on Gender based violence and domestic violence  and a study on social norms on violence and child disciplining.  The 2 studies will be launched in 2016 and C4D material to raise awareness on issues will be developed in early 2016.
8971/A0/04/003/024.indicator_name: Research is conducted on social norms related to Gender based violence and domestic violence

8971/A0/04/003/024.status_value: MOU between UNICEF and independent media Commission is signed in 2015.  The alliance is initiated with a number of prominent journalists and capacity building of journalists is undertaken to raise awareness on ethical guidelines and standards for media and children.
8971/A0/04/003/024.indicator_name: Media coalition for children rights is established

8971/A0/04/003/024.status_value: On-going. A MICS communication/dissemination plan was developed. A series of presentation meetings were organized with representatives of central and local institutions  civil society organisations and media. The dissemination activities will continue in 2016  engaging stakeholders in identifying potential reponse actions to reach the most vulnerable children and families  based on MICS data.

8971/A0/04/003/024.indicator_name: CRC@25 advocacy plan is prepared and implemented

8971/A0/04/003/024.status_value: On-going. Exclusive breastfeeding  immunization and parenting/child development have been identified as priority areas for the 1 000 Days Campaign. Additional research was identified as necessary to support the next phase: development and implementation of evidence-based activities.
8971/A0/04/003/024.indicator_name: The ECD Kosovo-wide Campaign on the first 1000 days is planned and approved

8971/A0/04/002/022.status_value: Comprehensive assessment of the implementation of the Strategy and Action Plan children's rights is completed. The process of drafting the new Strategy 2016-2020 has started with creating of the working group and stakeholder consultations at the central and municipal level.
8971/A0/04/002/022.indicator_name: Kosovo Children's Right's Action plan finalized 2014-2018

8971/A0/04/002/022.status_value: The New Law on Breatfeeding is promulgated in November 2015. (Ligji nr. 05/L-023 për mbrojtjen e të ushqyerit me qumësht gjiri)
APR action plan developed and adopted by Ministry of Health to reduce childhood preventable deaths

8971/A0/04/002/023.status_value: The Sectorial Strategy of the MLSW informed by unicef supported social protection mapping has been finalized and is pending final government approval. Nevertheless  certain measures foreseen in the strategy such as the improved adequacy of social assistance with 25% increase.
8971/A0/04/002/023.indicator_name: Existence of Kosovo Policy and   road map on Social protection in line with EU standards

8971/A0/04/002/023.status_value: With technical and financial support from UNICEF  KOMF been empowered to be an active stakeholder in child rights  advocating for legislative and policy reviews related to children rights  and media visibility - building also on strength of the member NGOs that form the coalition of KOMF.   Presently KOMF is adapting the Regional Child Protection Index adopted by CHILD PACT to Kosovo - composed of more than 600 indicators on child protection.
8971/A0/04/002/023.indicator_name: Annual Child Rights reporting by KOMF

8971/A0/04/002/023.status_value: While the additional cash benefit for children in families receiving social assistance continued to be paid  the government took the decision to increase the amount of monthly cash benefit for families by 25% starting from November 2015.
8971/A0/04/002/023.indicator_name: %of increase of coverage of the social protection scheme

8971/A0/04/002/024.status_value: For the third time  KAS has finalized TM data for Kosovo  and the same shared with RO
8971/A0/04/002/024.indicator_name: Availability of disaggregated data management system at central level (TransMonee)

8971/A0/04/002/024.status_value: There is ongoing policy dialogue between of the Office of Prime Minister  KAS and UNICEF to establish CR unit under KAS
8971/A0/04/002/024.indicator_name: Child Rights unit established in KAS

8971/A0/04/002/024.status_value: Key finding Reports (for general population and Roma  Ashkalia and Egyptian ethnicity) are published and being disseminated

8971/A0/04/003/020.status_value: Three additional municipalities have been exposed to OOSC initiative in 2015 and conducted situation analysis to inform development of their action plans on out of school children and drop out. While six municipalities  which were started prior to 2015 continue to implement and monitor their action plans and dropout in order to reduce out info school and drop out students.
8971/A0/04/003/020.indicator_name: Number of municipalities developed and implemented OOSC action plans

8971/A0/04/003/020.status_value: Further analysis on OOSC informed several key events advocacy with policy makers and key stakeholders  such as the Conference on Good practices on OOSC and Dropout  etc.

8971/A0/04/003/023.status_value: UNICEF has established CMRs in 12 municipalities to ensure multi-disciplinary and multi-stakeholder collaboration to manage cases of children in medium to high risk of being victims of abuse  exploitation  trafficking as well as children in conflict with the law
8971/A0/04/003/023.indicator_name: # of functional Case Management mechanisms in five municipalities

8971/A0/04/003/022.status_value: ECD municipal action plans have been drafted by multi-sectorial groups.
8971/A0/04/003/022.indicator_name: Municipal multi-sectorial action plans for ECD

8971/A0/04/003/022.status_value: All public preschool teachers' capacities have been developed to apply ELDS
8971/A0/04/003/022.indicator_name: % of existing early learning centers in targeted municipalities meet national standards for early learning (ELDS)

8971/A0/04/003/022.status_value: Mapping of ECD services completed in three municipalities and guided drafting of municipal action plans for improved ECD services
8971/A0/04/003/022.indicator_name: Mapping of ECD related services in three municipalities

8971/A0/04/003/022.status_value: areas of Mitrovica Region that have benefited from the 9 Community based Early Childhood Development centers provided support to the most marginalized children in Mitrovica region.
8971/A0/04/003/022.indicator_name: # of community based ECD centers functional to reach the most marginalized children in three municipalities

% of children managed by CMRs who are reintegrated (positive solutions)
Number of municipalities with action plan for strengthening child protection service provision
Low demand of parents to invest in children with disabilities
Corporal punishment and violence accepted form of discipline

8971/A0/04/003/006.status_value: This has been delayed for some time. A concerted effort will be made together with the EU in 2014 to institutionalize the roundtables. Scaling up Kosovo-wide will be the responsibility of Kosovo institutions
8971/A0/04/003/006.indicator_name: Functionality of Kosovo-wide Referral Case Management Roundtables

8971/A0/04/003/005.indicator_name: # of Local Youth Councils (LAC) functional in municipalities

8971/A0/04/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of allocated funds for communication
Increased immunization rates for most vulnerable groups

8971/A0/04/003/003.status_value: RCK continued with implementation of project and estimated to reach estimated 4 000 beneficiaries (2012 ¿ 2013). Increased and strengthen capacities of 127 volunteers of RCK.
8971/A0/04/003/003.indicator_name: # of beneficiaries reached by health outreach activities delivered by Red Cross Volunteer Network

8971/A0/04/003/003.status_value: Advocacy and follow-up with the NIPH for the EPI review to support strengthening of immunization services.
8971/A0/04/003/003.indicator_name: Availability of Kosovo immunization programme assessment

8971/A0/04/003/002.indicator_name: enrolment of children with disabilities in education (per levels of education)
enrollment of RAE in education ( per levels)
Number of municipalities benefited from inclusive education training programmes

8971/A0/04/003/002.status_value: CFS model has contributed to development of CFS Standards and their endorsement by MEST will further improve access and quality to inclusive education. UNICEF will provide support to central and local authorities for  dissemination of CFS standards through Out-of-School-Children interventions in six municipalities
8971/A0/04/003/002.indicator_name: # of schools supported through the Child-Friendly School initiative

8971/A0/05/004/001.indicator_name: Number of municipalities with local platforms to influence adolescents and youth healthy lifestyles
8971/A0/05/004/001.headline: The participation of Adolescents and youth in social camps/UPSHIFT has created local equity-based platforms in Kosovo. It has provided young people with skills that will make them more resilient and ready to unlock opportunities and simple solutions made possible by emerging technologies (Technology for development).

8971/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: % of data available in the TransMonEE database

8971/A0/04/004/001.status_value: UNICEF has supported KAS to take a central and pivotal role in data harmonization through participation in the regional TransMonEE initiative as well as through the use of CensusInfo and DevInfo to initiate the dialogue around statistical harmonization.
8971/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: Data is harmonized within the Social Statistics Sector
8971/A0/04/004/001.baseline_value: No  data is very fragmented with often various values for the same indicator within different institutions.

8971/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: The Statistical Council of KAS takes an active role in harmonization of data in the social statistical field

8971/A0/04/004/001.status_value: The Office of Good Governance has been supported to update the monitoring framework informing progress towards the Strategy and National Action Plan on Children Right's 2009-2013. This monitoring framework has allowed statistical data reporting rather than purely narrative reporting and forms the third in a series of monitoring reports that UNICEF has supported on implementation of the Strategy and Action Plan.
8971/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: Availablity of annually updated Monitoring and Reporting framework on Strategy and National Action Plan on Children Right's 2009-2013

8971/A0/04/004/002.indicator_name: # of reports (media coverage) on children's issues
# of UNICEF and partners public statements on Children's Issues
# of events on children's issues which received media coverage
# of UNICEF and partners public statements on Children's Issues

8971/A0/04/004/002.status_value: UNICEF has supported both CSOs and Government to ensure relevant reports are widely disseminated in various formats and languages to heighten accessibility towards the materials. Noteworthy examples include the  launch of the State of the World's Children report in 2013 which was attended by the President of Kosovo. UNICEF also supported KOMF to produce a wide variety of statements on children's issues throughout the year.
8971/A0/04/004/002.indicator_name: Relevant reports on children and women publicly available in English  Albanian and Serbian

Legislation and policies for protection of child victims and witnesses are in place
Limited availability of specialized services mandated by the Law on Social and Family Services

8971/A0/04/002/001.status_value: The mapping and assessment was finalized in 2012 and is available.
8971/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: Availability of country-led Child Protection Systems Mapping and Assessment

8971/A0/04/002/021.status_value: The Office of Good Governance has been supported to update the monitoring framework informing progress towards the Strategy and National Action Plan on Children Right's 2009-2013. This monitoring framework has allowed statistical data reporting rather than purely narrative reporting and forms the third in a series of monitoring reports that UNICEF has supported on implementation of the Strategy and Action Plan.
8971/A0/04/002/021.indicator_name: Availablity of Annual Reports by Kosovo Government on Strategy and National Action Plan on Children Right's 2009-2013
Strengthened capacities of the Assembly of Kosovo in monitoring of children's rights

The home visiting practice has contributed to reduce equity gaps and to build trust between local healthcare system and families in seven municipalities.

Increase of budget allocation for the implementation of the JJ Code
Weak and scattered data management and no proper monitoring mechanisms

8971/A0/04/003/021.status_value: Road Map on Home Visiting developed  that will contributed to increase quality and coverage of mother and child health services  and to promote health and wellbeing of young children and their families  particularly the most vulnerable.
8971/A0/04/003/021.indicator_name: Road Map (Action Plan) for Home Visiting

8971/A0/04/003/021.status_value: Developed by MoH in collaboration with CSO's
The Nutritional Action Plan was finalized and in process for approval.

8971/A0/04/002/005.indicator_name: Endorsement of Municipal Youth Action Plans (MYAP)  especially in minority-based municipalities
8971/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: None of the newly created municipalities  especailly with majority minority-based population had a MYAP approved.

8971/A0/04/002/005.status_value: During this year  a new Kosovo Youth Strategy and Action Plan 2013-2017 has been developed and adopted by the Government.
8971/A0/04/002/005.indicator_name: Adoption of Kosovo Youth Strategy and Action Plan 2013-2017
Number of Local Youth Action Councils that are functional
Number developed and approved Municipal Youth Action Plans

8971/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: number of administration instructions that support access to quality education of the most vulnerable children

8971/A0/04/002/002.status_value: ELDS in-service teacher training programme is finalized and its implementation in preschool institutions is in progress. (Evaluation report   May 2013)
8971/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: Adoption of Early Learning Development Standards (ELDS) for age 0-6

8971/A0/04/002/003.status_value: The Law of Flour Fortification is approved in 2012 and enforced from April 2013. Sub-legal act for standards for flour fortification is endorsed in August 2013
8971/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: Adoption of Law of Flour Fortification

8971/A0/04/002/025.status_value: The collaboration between the Ministry of Youth  Culture and Sports/Department of Youth and Civil Society Organisations has resulted in the development of Municipal Youth Action Plans in four minority-northern Kosovo municipalities  for the first time in the post-conflict era.
8971/A0/04/002/025.indicator_name: Municipal Youth Action Plans developed and approved by municipal assemblies

8971/A0/04/003/009.indicator_name: Strengthened capacities of civil society groups to advocate for most vulnerable groups

8971/A0/04/003/009.status_value: The first KOMF Annual Report on the situation of children in Kosovo launched in January 2013. The consecutive annual report will be published during 2014.
8971/A0/04/003/009.indicator_name: Availability of KOMF Annual Report on the situation of children in Kosovo

8971/A0/04/003/017.indicator_name: # of youth leaders from Youth Centers (YC's) actively engaged in Innovations Lab activities and trainings
Improved quality of services provided to youth in YC's

8971/A0/04/003/017.status_value: The Innovations Lab programme has reached out and had involvement of more than 2 000 youth  not only in terms of activities but also as beneficiaries of the small youth-led projects  either directly and/or indirectly.
8971/A0/04/003/017.indicator_name: # of youth engaged in UNICEF's Innovation Lab

8971/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: Evidence-based and measurable C4D plan (stand alone or part of a sectorial plan) to improve the adoption of key norms and behaviors and increase demand for social basic services available
8971/A0/05/002/004.headline: Strengthened collaboration with media to promote voice and accountability for children's rights  to generate knowledge on social issues  norms  behaviors and attitudes  and to mobilize political will to invest more in children  and to make issues affecting children more visible in the public debate.

8971/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: Partnerships with media institutions to strengthen media professionals
8971/A0/05/002/004.headline: Strengthened collaboration with media to promote voice and accountability for children's rights  to generate knowledge on social issues  norms  behaviors and attitudes  and to mobilize political will to invest more in children  and to make issues affecting children more visible in the public debate.

8971/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection
8971/A0/05/002/003.headline: Strengthened Strategic engagement with policy makers  CSOs  municipalities and other relevant stakeholders to make institutions more accountable and responsive to issues affecting children's rights  and to make the existing social protection scheme more inclusive and equitable for all children and eligible families.

8971/A0/05/002/001.status_value: The office of Prime Minister has institutionalized the Report Card on the situation of Children's rights.   The Report Card is a simplification and an adaptation of the existing annual progress reporting system to elevate the level of responsiveness and accountability by Kosovo institutions.
8971/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Periodic monitoring  reports on child rights by Kosovo institutions
8971/A0/05/002/001.headline: Child Rights monitoring and reporting systems strengthened at central and local levels to make institutions more accountable and responsive to issues affecting children  and to generate knowledge and evidence as a basis to inform national policy agenda and public debate for children&#39 s rights.
